channel.title: Noobscape v3 exp edit
channel.description:
I thought i would make this thread and bring out some editted exp files because obviously it is annoying having to edit all exp. I will keep adding more tommorow.It is late now so im going to go sleep for now lol but i am just trying help out if it does help. The exp numbers for the skills have been editted so it is same as real rs so that when you use your exp muliplyer it does not go crazy high.
objectcrafting.xml objectfishing.xml objectwoodcutting.xml
http://www.mediafire.com/?jomwyz22yyz
Heres a few more i have done:
firemakingdef.xml itemherbdef.xml itemherbsecond.xml itemsmeltingdef.xml itemunidentherbdef.xml
http://www.mediafire.com/?dzx0nuzgztc

item.title: Noobscape v3 exp edit
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:7, topic:339906”][quote author=Nemesis- link=topic=436279.msg3224876#msg3224876 date=1275493579]
Question, Why edit the XML files? you could simply add serverside multipler.
for example:
int exp = getDef().getExp() * 3;
[/quote]Because on EasyRSC (maybe RSCD), the XML files have the base exp. So if they base exp is extreamly high, the multiplier gets fucked. You’re supposed to edit the XMLs to have original RSC exp, then multiply.[/quote]
Why edit the base experience in first place?
How the multipler gets ‘fucked up’?

Let’s say the CookingDef has 30 experience set on shrimp,
(This is what I used)

InvUseOnObject class:

owner.incExp(7, cookingDef.getExp() * Server.getSkillMultipler(), true);

Server class:

private static int skillMultipler = 15;

public statc int getSkillMultipler() {
      return skillMultipler;
}

How can this fuck up?

Read full topic
